message_1:
The Caesar cipher is an encryption technique that shifts each letter in a message by a certain number of positions down the alphabet. If you are given a message "Hello" and shift the letters by 3 positions, the message becomes "Khoor". 

Suppose you receive a Caeser cipher encrypted message "Jnufyx", and you know that the shift used to encrypt the message is 6 (i.e., each letter is shifted 6 positions down the alphabet). What is the original message before encryption?
message_2:
To decrypt the Caesar cipher encrypted message "Jnufyx" with a shift of 6, we need to shift each letter 6 positions up the alphabet.

J -> C (6 positions up)
n -> h (6 positions up)
u -> o (6 positions up)
f -> z (6 positions up)
y -> s (6 positions up)
x -> t (6 positions up)

The original message before encryption is "Chozst".
